intro: Dimerostemma oblongum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dimerostemma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Dimerostemma oblongum is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique foliage and floral display.
